intro: Ditremexa occidentalis, commonly known as the western ditremexa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with ecological significance in its native habitat.
